author: fearthecowboy
body: Added the code to build Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.Native assembly. Also adds a script to build packages for all the projects. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/powershell/powershell/507)

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Just FYI, the configurations can be used to conditionally add dependencies, which we could use to do Windows and Linux specific things.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
I've had some thoughts on this lately. We're going to end up with two versions of MMIN. The real one on Windows, and @zach-folwick's replacement for it on Linux.

We will need to take a runtime specific dependency on two different projects (blocked by NuGet/Home#1660). It would turn into a three packages, the MMIN API referenced by the rest of the project, and it would reference the Linux and Windows versions, much the same way that .NET Core builds platform specific packages.

comments.author: zach-folwick
comments.body: I think we can safely close this PR.
